result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas A Mertz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court finds defendant eligible for CIP and SAP programs only after serving 2 years confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution due as follows: $403 due to Hartford Park & Rec Dept on 14cf456; $262.94 due to Linda K. on 14cf455.
If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with West Side Park in Hartford nor with Adam K.

Defendant shall pay Dept of Corrections supervision fees.
Defendant shall participate in an AODA assessment, a psychological evaluation and all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or school or a combination thereof.
Defendant shall maintain a stable residence. 
Defendant shall notify his supervising agent within 48 hours of being prescribed medication. 
Defendant shall avoid contact with people who use or possess controlled substances.
